result.execSummary:
The defendant Sostenes Maldonado was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

supervisions.notes: Court will allow for early termination of probation if Agent deems appropriate at any point after 6 months.  Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended if Agent deems appropriate.

Court will allow for travel to Mexico to deal with family issues.
No violent contact with the victim listed in the Criminal Complaint.
Anger Management or Domestic Violence Counseling and follow through as Agent deems appropriate.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sostenes Maldonado

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
Allowing defendant to travel to Mexico from 3/25/17 to 4/11/17 as long as the defendant remains in compliance wtih Department of Corrections.

Filed by Atty. Reyes, requesting his client be allowed to travel to Mexico for two weeks to visit his seriously ill mother.

03/16/17 - Court Reviewed - Request Granted - Court will allow the defendant to visit his ill mother for two weeks in Mexico - Attorney notified by phone on 03/16/17.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

David Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Sostenes Maldonado in court with attorney Michael Reyes.  
Patrick Ryan appeared as interpreter.  Sworn in.
Jury Trial Cancelled.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 2.
Count 1 is dismissed as a read in.


Court orders the following:
SENTENCE WITHHELD.

Term of Probation:  12 Months.
Court will allow for early termination of probation if agent deems appropriate at any point after 6 months.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Court will allow for travel to Mexico to deal with family issues.
Anger Management or DV Counseling and follow through as agent deems appropriate.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended if agent deems appropriate.
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No violent contact with:  victim listed in the criminal complaint.
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).


Costs:  $243
DV Surcharge:  $100
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
